lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the elf from the movie Harry Potter, _Dobby_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
2. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
3. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

4. After that, locate the `src/main/java/dobby/Dobby.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Dobby.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
> Dobby is a chat-bot that aims to help users keep track of their daily tasks.
1. Ensure you have Java `11` installed in your Computer.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for Dobby.
4. Double-click the file to start Dobby.
### Adding 3 types of tasks: Todo, Event and Deadline.
Three different task types to keep track off.
### Mark and Unmark tasks as done.
Status of tasks can be marked and unmarked by the user.
Tasks with descriptions which contain a certain keyword can be found and printed out.
Unwanted tasks can be deleted by the user.
Users can customize their own preferred command for each function.
Tasks can be listed out, both done and not-done for the user to refer to. The status of tasks will be shown as well.
Adds a todo task into the task list. A todo is a general task.
The newly added todo task, as well as the number of tasks in the task list.
Yes master, Dobby will add the following task to the list:
Adds a deadline task into the task list. A deadline is a task with a due date.
The newly added description task, as well as the number of tasks in the task list.
Yes master, Dobby will add the following task to the list:
Adds a event task into the task list. An event is a task with a date of the event.
The newly added description task, as well as the number of tasks in the task list.
Yes master, Dobby will add the following task to the list:
Lists out all tasks, both done and not-done for the user to refer to. The status of tasks will be shown as well.
"Here are the tasks Dobby has found:"
Updates the status of a task to done.
Expected outcome for tasks that were not marked as done:
Well done master! Dobby has marked the following task as done:
Expected outcome for tasks that were marked as done:
Dobby has already marked this task done!
### `unmark` - Mark a task as not done
Updates the status of a task to not done.
Expected outcome for tasks that were marked as done:
OK, Dobby will take care of
Expected outcome for tasks that were not marked as done:
Master has never marked this task done before...
Removes a task from the task list permanently.
Task deleted! Less work for master! Dobby is HAAAAAPPY!
Lists out tasks whose description contain the given keyword or phrase.
Dobby has found the following relevant tasks:
Customizes the command to call each function.
Yes master, from now on dobby will do [todo] when dobby sees [dobbyTodo].

* Error message when no date is added to deadline.
printChat("Please add the deadline after the task name using /by");
* Error message when no date is added to event.
printChat("Please add the event date after the task name using /at");
* Error message when false command is entered.
printChat("Dobby doesn't understand what you're saying...press commands to see all commands that Dobby "
* Error message when no task number is added to mark, unmark or delete command.
printChat("You need to tell Dobby the task number...");
* Error message when no task description is added after command.
printChat("You need to tell Dobby the task you wish to add...");
* Error message when user enters non-number after mark, unmark or delete command.
* Error message when user runs commands on a task number not availble on the task list.
printChat("There aren't that many tasks...would you like Dobby to add more?");
* Error message when user runs commands on an empty task list.
printChat("Dobby doesn't see any task to delete");
* Error message when user enters a negative number after mark, unmark or delete command.
printChat("Dobby only knows numbers more than 0...");
* Error message when user tries to mark an already marked task.
printChat("Dobby has already marked this task done!");
* Error message when user tries to unmark an already unmarked task.
printChat("Master has never marked this task done before...");
* Error message when the file containing past saved task list has tasks in a wrong format.
printChat("Dobby doesn't understand what's written here...");
* Message printed when the file containing past saved task list is empty.
printChat("No tasks left, Dobby is FREEEEEEEEEEEE!");
* Error message when user enters dates in the wrong format after the event/date command.
printChat("Master, please write dates using the YYYY-MM-DD HHMM format");
printChat("Dobby can't find any previous tasks to load from");
printChat("Please tell dobby which command you wish to simplify.");

DobbyPro frees your mind of having to remember things you need to do. It's
All you need to do is,
4. let it manage your tasks for you :elf:
If you are a Java programmer, you can use it to practice Java too! Here's the `main` method:
